keyMoments.title: Red Hawk Against Hody
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses Red Hawk to counter Hody's savage bite attacks, demonstrating his new fire-enhanced punch technique.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's ability to combine his rubber powers with fire and Haki, creating devastating new techniques.

keyMoments.title: Elephant Gun Defeats Hody
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses Elephant Gun, a Haki-enhanced Gear Third attack, to deliver the decisive blow against Hody Jones.
keyMoments.significance: The finishing move that defeats the main antagonist of the Fish-Man Island Arc, proving Luffy's mastery of combining Devil Fruit powers with Haki.

keyMoments.title: Elephant Gatling Attacks Noah
keyMoments.description: Luffy unleashes Elephant Gatling, a rapid barrage of giant punches, in an attempt to destroy the Noah ship.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's incredible destructive power when trying to save Fish-Man Island from destruction.

abilities.description: A Gear Third technique where Luffy inflates his arm to giant size and coats it with Busoshoku Haki, delivering a devastating punch with increased power and hardness.
A rapid-fire version of Elephant Gun where Luffy unleashes multiple giant, Haki-enhanced punches in quick succession.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Controlled Monster Point Reveal
keyMoments.description: Chopper reveals he now only needs one Rumble Ball to access Monster Point and can control the form for three minutes.
keyMoments.significance: Major power upgrade showing Chopper has mastered his most powerful transformation, which was previously uncontrollable.
keyMoments.quote: By eating a single Rumble Ball, I can fight in this form for three minutes.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Dosun with Monster Point
keyMoments.description: Using his controlled Monster Point, Chopper shatters Dosun's iron hammer and critically injures the hammerhead shark fish-man.
keyMoments.significance: Proves Monster Point is now a reliable combat form rather than a desperate last resort.

abilities.description: An improved version of Monster Point that requires only one Rumble Ball and can be controlled for three minutes, unlike the previous uncontrollable berserker form.

reveals.information: Chopper can now control Monster Point with only one Rumble Ball for three minutes

keyMoments.title: Defeats Hyouzou
keyMoments.description: Zoro defeats Hyouzou, Fish-Man Island's best swordsman, calling him 'a frog in a well' to emphasize the vast difference in their abilities.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that Zoro's training with Mihawk has elevated him far beyond even the strongest swordsman on Fish-Man Island.
keyMoments.quote: You're just a frog in a well.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Wadatsumi with Hell Memories
keyMoments.description: After Jinbe's Vagabond Drill, Sanji finishes Wadatsumi with Hell Memories, a powerful fire kick that completely chars the giant fish-man.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sanji's powerful fire-based techniques developed during his time on Momoiro Island.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Daruma with Pop Greens
keyMoments.description: Usopp uses his new botanical weapons, including Green Star: Human Drake and Green Star: Impact Wolf, to defeat Daruma.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's combat abilities using the Pop Greens he cultivated on the Boin Archipelago.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Ikaros Much with Franky Radical Beam
keyMoments.description: Franky exits his General Franky robot and uses Franky Radical Beam, a powerful laser attack, to defeat Ikaros Much.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky's cybernetic upgrades obtained from Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory during the time skip.

abilities.description: A powerful laser beam attack created using technology Franky learned from Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Zeo with Ice Abilities
keyMoments.description: Brook uses his ice-based abilities to finish off Zeo, the camouflaging Japanese wobbegong fish-man.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Brook's mastery of ice abilities gained during the two-year training period.

name.japanese: ホーディ・ジョーンズ

keyMoments.title: Savage Bite Attacks on Luffy
keyMoments.description: Empowered by Energy Steroids, Hody grabs Luffy and bites him repeatedly in the same spot, showing his brutal fighting style.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates both the temporary power of Energy Steroids and Hody's savage, animalistic nature.

keyMoments.title: Final Defeat by Luffy
keyMoments.description: Hody is blasted unconscious from Noah after Luffy's Elephant Gatling attack, marking the end of the New Fish-Man Pirates' threat.
keyMoments.significance: Concludes Hody's attempted coup and shows that even with Energy Steroids, he is no match for the post-time skip Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Defeats Wadatsumi with Sanji
keyMoments.description: Jinbe uses Vagabond Drill on Wadatsumi, setting up Sanji's finishing attack with Hell Memories.
keyMoments.significance: Shows effective teamwork between Jinbe and the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Zoro
keyMoments.description: Hyouzou, Fish-Man Island's best swordsman and master of Eight Sword Style, is easily defeated by Zoro who dismisses him as 'a frog in a well.'
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that even Fish-Man Island's greatest swordsman is far beneath Zoro's level after training with Mihawk.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Brook
keyMoments.description: Zeo, the Japanese wobbegong fish-man with camouflage abilities, is finished off by Brook's ice-based attacks.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that even with Energy Steroids, the New Fish-Man Pirates officers are no match for the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Usopp
keyMoments.description: Daruma, the cookiecutter shark fish-man known for burrowing abilities, is defeated by Usopp's Pop Green techniques.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's growth and new botanical combat abilities.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Chopper
keyMoments.description: Dosun, the hammerhead shark fish-man with a massive hammer, is defeated by Chopper's controlled Monster Point, which shatters his weapon.
keyMoments.significance: First victim of Chopper's controlled Monster Point, proving the form's effectiveness.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Franky
keyMoments.description: Ikaros Much, the giant squid fish-man with dried squid spears, is defeated by Franky's Radical Beam.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Franky's upgraded laser technology from Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory.

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Jinbe and Sanji
keyMoments.description: The giant fish-man Wadatsumi is defeated by a combination attack from Jinbe's Vagabond Drill and Sanji's Hell Memories.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the Straw Hats' ability to coordinate with allies and Sanji's powerful fire techniques.
